description_txt: stated on July 8, 2012 in a Tweet:
quote_txt: "Unemployment rate dropped in every state that elected a Republican gov. in 2010"

description_txt: stated on June 27, 2012 in an email:
quote_txt: Gov. Rick Scott "tried to kick 180,000 people off the voter rolls."

description_txt: stated on June 27, 2012 in an email:
quote_txt: "Every one of the 67 supervisors of elections" in Florida refused to carry out the effort to remove noncitizens from the voter rolls.

description_txt: stated on July 8, 2012 in an interview on CNN's "State of the Union":
quote_txt: Says Mitt Romney "has a corporation in Bermuda (but) failed to disclose that on seven different financial disclosures."

description_txt: stated on June 18, 2012 in a campaign ad:
quote_txt: Montana Democratic Sen. Jon Tester is "the largest recipient of lobbyist money."

description_txt: stated on June 29, 2012 in a television interview:
quote_txt: Sixteen thousand new Internal Revenue Service agents will be "empowered to enforce" the new health care legislation.

description_txt: stated on June 22, 2012 in a Republican US Senate debate at KERA-TV, Channel 13, in Dallas.:
quote_txt: "I've never supported a payroll tax."

description_txt: stated on July 3, 2012 in on the Internet:
quote_txt: "75 percent of the Obamacare tax falls on the middle class."

description_txt: stated on June 28, 2012 in prepared remarks:
quote_txt: " ‘Obamacare’ puts the federal government between you and your doctor."

description_txt: stated on May 30, 2012 in a news conference:
quote_txt: Toothpaste contains "the poison substance of fluoride."

description_txt: stated on July 2, 2012 in an interview on WNYC’s The Brian Lehrer Show:
quote_txt: Says "tenure still exists but it's been overhauled" for teachers in New Jersey.

description_txt: stated on June 26, 2012 in a speech:
quote_txt: The federal government has made investments in science and technology inventing the products that led to the creation of Google.

description_txt: stated on June 13, 2012 in an interview:
quote_txt: If the U.S. didn't borrow $1.2 trillion every year "to fund government operations," that money would be available "for entrepreneurs and business people to put to work creating jobs and building and expanding their businesses."

description_txt: stated on June 26, 2012 in a video posted on YouTube:
quote_txt: Says state Sen. Paul Sarlo "said in February on NJTV, ‘there will be no tax increases in this budget’" and "voted the other night in the Senate Budget Committee to raise income taxes $800 million."

description_txt: stated on July 29, 2012 in a panel discussion on "A Lively Experiment":
quote_txt: "Two thirds to three quarters of people without [health] insurance in Rhode Island work."
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • July 8, 2012

description_txt: stated on June 27, 2012 in Posted by Ciparro's website:
quote_txt: "In the last 10 years, only one piece of legislation has been cosponsored and passed by" John Duncan Jr.

description_txt: stated on June 8, 2012 in his speech at the Texas Democratic Party State Convention in Houston:
quote_txt: Says cuts by Gov. Rick Perry's administration left "12,000 teachers without a job."

description_txt: stated on June 20, 2012 in a newsletter.:
quote_txt: Says "while state leaders have cut funding for our schools and other basic priorities, the amount of money the state is projected to give away through tax breaks increased by a whopping $3.4 billion."

description_txt: stated on July 1, 2012 in on 'Meet the Press':
quote_txt: Under the health care law, "everybody will have lower rates, better quality care and better access."

description_txt: stated on July 2, 2012 in a Fox News interview:
quote_txt: Says the Congressional Budget Office "said if you’re going to buy your own policy with these (health care) exchanges you’ll be paying 10 percent more ... about $2,100 more for a family."

description_txt: stated on June 29, 2012 in a TV interview.:
quote_txt: States still face a "mandate" to expand Medicaid coverage under President Obama's health care reform law.

description_txt: stated on June 17, 2012 in a television interview:
quote_txt: Voter fraud provided "a portion" of the margin of victory of Democrat John Lehman over Republican Sen. Van Wanggaard in a state Senate recall election.

description_txt: stated on July 4, 2012 in an interview with CBS News:
quote_txt: The Supreme Court said the individual mandate "is a tax. So it's a tax."

description_txt: stated on June 22, 2012 in a campaign press release:
quote_txt: Says Clackamas County Measure 3-401 "will hurt our county, cripple economic growth, and increase our taxes with excessive special elections."

description_txt: stated on July 1, 2012 in an interview on CBS's "Face the Nation":
quote_txt: The United States has "the best health care delivery system in the world."

description_txt: stated on May 9, 2012 in a campaign mailer:
quote_txt: The Mack Penny Plan for the federal budget  "would balance our budget by 2019" and "continues to gain support."

description_txt: stated on June 4, 2012 in a speech:
quote_txt: By eliminating the public intervenor’s office, "I was the first one to fire Kathleen Falk."

description_txt: stated on July 3, 2012 in an interview on CNBC:
quote_txt: "If you look at most of the polls, this is a margin-of-error race on Fourth of July between Mitt Romney and the president."

description_txt: stated on June 14, 2012 in a radio appearance:
quote_txt: The Wisconsin Retirement System for public employees is "a self-funded pension plan" and "it’s the money of the workers’ that funds it."

description_txt: stated on July 2, 2012 in a speech before the state Legislature:
quote_txt: Says "our 12 month job increase was the sixth highest in the nation."
